007package renderer.models_TP;
008
009import renderer.scene.*;
010import renderer.scene.primitives.*;
011import renderer.scene.util.MeshMaker_TP;
012import renderer.scene.util.MeshType;
013
014/**
015   Create a solid model of a right circular cylinder
016   with its axis along the y-axis.
017<p>
018   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cylinder" target="_top">
019                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cylinder</a>
020<p>
021   This model can also be used to create right k-sided polygonal prisms.
022<p>
023   See <a href="https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prism_(geometry)" target="_top">
024                https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Prism_(geometry)</a>
025
026   @see CylinderSector
027*/
028public class Cylinder extends Model implements MeshMaker_TP
029{
030   public final double r;
031   public final double h;
032   public final int n;
033   public final int k;
034   public final MeshType type;
035
036   /**
037      Create a right circular cylinder with radius 1 and its
038      axis along the y-axis from {@code y = 1} to {@code y = -1}.
039   */
040   public Cylinder( )
041   {
042      this(1, 1, 15, 16);
043   }
044
045
046   /**
047      Create a right circular cylinder with radius {@code r} and
048      its axis along the y-axis from {@code y = h} to {@code y = -h}.
049
050      @param r  radius of the cylinder
051      @param h  height of the cylinder (from h to -h along the y-axis)
052   */
053   public Cylinder(final double r, final double h)
054   {
055      this(r, h, 15, 16);
056   }
057
058
059   /**
060      Create a right circular cylinder with radius {@code r} and
061      its axis along the y-axis from {@code y = h} to {@code y = -h}.
062   <p>
063      The last two parameters determine the number of lines of longitude
064      and the number of circles of latitude in the model.
065   <p>
066      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude in the model (including
067      the top and bottom edges), then each line of longitude will have
068      {@code n+1} line segments. If there are {@code k} lines of longitude,
069      then each circle of latitude will have {@code k} line segments.
070   <p>
071      There must be at least three lines of longitude and at least
072      two circles of latitude.
073   <p>
074      By setting {@code k} to be a small integer, this model can also be
075      used to create k-sided polygonal prisms.
076
077      @param r  radius of the cylinder
078      @param h  height of the cylinder (from h to -h along the y-axis)
079      @param n  number of circles of latitude around the cylinder
080      @param k  number of lines of longitude
081      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
082      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 4
083   */
084   public Cylinder(final double r, final double h,
085                   final int n, final int k)
086   {
087      this(r, h, n, k, MeshType.HORIZONTAL);
088   }
089
090
091   /**
092      Create a right circular cylinder with radius {@code r} and
093      its axis along the y-axis from {@code y = h} to {@code y = -h}.
094   <p>
095      The last two parameters determine the number of lines of longitude
096      and the number of circles of latitude in the model.
097   <p>
098      If there are {@code n} circles of latitude in the model (including
099      the top and bottom edges), then each line of longitude will have
100      {@code n+1} line segments. If there are {@code k} lines of longitude,
101      then each circle of latitude will have {@code k} line segments.
102   <p>
103      There must be at least three lines of longitude and at least
104      two circles of latitude.
105   <p>
106      By setting {@code k} to be a small integer, this model can also be
107      used to create k-sided polygonal prisms.
108
109      @param r  radius of the cylinder
110      @param h  height of the cylinder (from h to -h along the y-axis)
111      @param n  number of circles of latitude around the cylinder
112      @param k  number of lines of longitude
113      @param type  choose between horizoantal, vertical, and checkerboard triangle strips
114      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code n} is less than 2
115      @throws IllegalArgumentException if {@code k} is less than 4
116   */
117   public Cylinder(final double r, final double h,
118                   final int n, final int k,
119                   final MeshType type)
120   {
121      super(String.format("Cylinder(%.2f,%.2f,%d,%d)", r, h, n, k));
122
123      if (n < 2)
124         throw new IllegalArgumentException("n must be greater than 1");
125      if (k < 4)
126         throw new IllegalArgumentException("k must be greater than 3");
127
128      this.r = r;
129      this.h = h;
130      this.n = n;
131      this.k = k;
132      this.type = type;
133
134      // Create the cylinder's geometry.
135
136      final double deltaH = (2.0 * h) / (n - 1),
137                   deltaTheta = (2.0 * Math.PI) / (k - 1);
138
139      // An array of vertices to be used to create triangles.
140      final Vertex[][] v = new Vertex[n][k];
141
142      // Create all the vertices.
143      for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose an angle of longitude
144      {
145         final double c = Math.cos(j * deltaTheta),
146                      s = Math.sin(j * deltaTheta);
147         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
148         {
149            v[i][j] = new Vertex(r * c,
150                                 h - i * deltaH,
151                                 r * s );
152         }
153      }
154      final Vertex topCenter    = new Vertex(0,  h, 0),
155                   bottomCenter = new Vertex(0, -h, 0);
156
157      // Add all of the vertices to this model.
158      for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i)
159      {
160         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j)
161         {
162            addVertex( v[i][j] );
163         }
164      }
165      addVertex(topCenter,
166                bottomCenter);
167      final int topCenterIndex    = n * k,
168                bottomCenterIndex = n * k + 1;
169
170
171      // Create all the triangle strips along the cylinder wall.
172      if (MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type)
173      {
174         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
175         {
176            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
177            for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
178            {
179               triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + j);  // v[i+1][j]
180               triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + j);  // v[i  ][j]
181            }
182            triStrip.addIndex((1+i)* k + 0);  // v[i+1][0]
183            triStrip.addIndex(   i * k + 0);  // v[i  ][0]
184            addPrimitive(triStrip);
185         }
186      }
187      else if (MeshType.VERTICAL == type)
188      {
189         for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
190         {
191            final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
192            triStrip.addIndex(topCenterIndex);
193            for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
194            {
195               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j+1);  // v[i][j+1]
196               triStrip.addIndex(i * k + j);    // v[i][j  ]
197            }
198            triStrip.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
199            addPrimitive(triStrip);
200         }
201         // Last vertical strip to close the frustum.
202         final Primitive triStrip = new TriangleStrip();
203         triStrip.addIndex(topCenterIndex);
204         for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
205         {
206            triStrip.addIndex(i * k + 0);    // v[i][0  ]
207            triStrip.addIndex(i * k + k-1);  // v[i][k-1]
208         }
209         triStrip.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
210         addPrimitive(triStrip);
211      }
212      else // MeshType.CHECKER triangle strips
213      {
214         for (int i = 0; i < n - 1; ++i) // choose a circle of latitude
215         {
216            for (int j = 0; j < k - 1; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
217            {
218               addPrimitive(
219                  new TriangleStrip((1+i)* k + j,       // v[i+1][j  ]
220                                       i * k + j,       // v[i  ][j  ]
221                                    (1+i)* k + j + 1,   // v[i+1][j+1]
222                                       i * k + j + 1)); // v[i  ][j+1]
223            }
224            addPrimitive(
225               new TriangleStrip((1+i)* k + k - 1, // v[i+1][k-1]
226                                    i * k + k - 1, // v[i  ][k-1]
227                                 (1+i)* k + 0,     // v[i+1][0  ]
228                                    i * k + 0));   // v[i  ][0  ]
229         }
230      }
231
232      if ( MeshType.HORIZONTAL == type
233        || MeshType.CHECKER == type )
234      {
235         // Create the triangle fan at the top.
236         final Primitive topFan = new TriangleFan();
237         topFan.addIndex(topCenterIndex);
238         for (int j = k - 1; j >= 0; --j) // choose a line of longitude
239         {
240             topFan.addIndex( j ); // v[0][j]
241         }
242         topFan.addIndex( k-1 );   // v[0][k-1]
243         addPrimitive(topFan);
244
245         // Create the triangle fan at the bottom.
246         final Primitive botFan = new TriangleFan();
247         botFan.addIndex(bottomCenterIndex);
248         for (int j = 0; j < k; ++j) // choose a line of longitude
249         {
250            botFan.addIndex( ((n-1)*k)+j ); // v[n-1][j]
251         }
252         botFan.addIndex( ((n-1)*k)+0 );    // v[n-1][0]
253         addPrimitive(botFan);
254      }
255   }
256
257
258
259   // Implement the MeshMaker_TP interface (four methods).
260   @Override public int getHorzCount() {return n;}
261
262   @Override public int getVertCount() {return k;}
263
264   @Override public MeshType getType() {return type;}
265
266   @Override
267   public Cylinder remake(final int n, final int k, final MeshType type)
268   {
269      return new Cylinder(this.r, this.h,
270                          n, k,
271                          type);
272   }
273}//Cylinder
